title.narrative: EBRD SWUK 2 (2020) - Ukraine Municipal Infrastructure Cooperation Account
EBRD SWUK 2 (2020) - Ukraine Municipal Infrastructure Cooperation Account

description.narrative:
Detta är en fond upprättad mellan Europeiska banken för återuppbyggnad och utveckling (EBRD) och Sida för att stödja EBRD:s portfölj för infrastrukturinvesteringar i Ukraina med finansiering av uppdrag för tekniskt bistånd.
EBRD ger lån över hela Ukraina för att utveckla, förbättra och modernisera ett brett spektrum av kommunal service, inklusive fjärrvärme, vatten och avlopp, kollektivtrafik (förnyelse av fordonspark, vägnät, tunnelbana och e-biljettsystem), avfallshantering och energieffektivitet i offentliga byggnader och bostadshus, med prestationsbaserade entreprenadstrukturer, tillsammans med smarta lösningar. För utveckling av den kommunala infrastrukturen tillhandahåller EBRD finansiering direkt till kommunerna.
De kommunala bolagen lider av underfinansiering, otillräckliga konsumentavgifter och brist på kvalificerad personal. De har en mycket begränsad intern kapacitet att förbereda och följa upp genomförandet av tekniskt utmanande eller stora investeringsprojekt. De behöver därför stöd att komplettera dessa viktiga funktioner med erfarna internationella och lokala konsulter som kan finansieras av den föreslagna fonden.
Den föreslagna insatsen kommer att göra det möjligt för ambassaden att fortsätta ge tekniskt bistånd till viktiga kommunala investeringar i en rad sektorer i Ukraina. Fonden har samma upplägg som det befintliga samarbetet mellan EBRD och ambassaden där uppdragen förbereds, förvaltas och följs upp av EBRD, medan ambassaden efterhand godkänner projekten. Fondens storlek baseras på projektprognoser gjorda av EBRD och uppgår till 75 MSEK för den femårsperiod som inleds 2021.

This is the trust fund between the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) and Sida to support the municipal infrastructure investment portfolio of the EBRD in Ukraine with the financing for the technical assistance assignments.
The EBRD provides loans across the length and breadth of Ukraine to develop, improve and modernize a wide spectrum of municipal activities, including district heating, water and wastewater, urban transport (fleet renewal, urban roads, metros and e-ticketing), solid waste management and energy efficiency in public and residential buildings, using performance based contracting structures, together with smart solutions. On the municipal infrastructure front, the EBRD took a non-sovereign lending approach by providing financing directly to municipalities.
The municipal companies in Ukraine are suffering from underinvestment, inadequate tariff policies and drain of qualified personnel and have very limited internal capacity to prepare and supervise implementation of technically challenging or large-scale investment projects. These critical functions can be carried out by experienced international and local consultants financed from the proposed trust fund.
The proposed support to the trust fund will allow the Embassy/Sida to continue technical assistance support of critical municipal investments across a range of sub-sectors in Ukraine. The trust fund will maintain the operational model of the existing cooperation between the EBRD and the Embassy/Sida with the assignments being prepared, managed and supervised by the EBRD while the Embassy/Sida will maintain the right to provide prior approval to all eligible assignments. Indicative size of the fund based on the provided pipeline of assignments forecast by the EBRD is 75 MSEK for the coming 5 year period starting in 2021.

The overall objective of the contribution is to promote necessary reforms and support critical infrastructure investments in the municipal sector of Ukraine by providing the EBRD with access to the dedicated grant funding for technical cooperation assignments. Technical cooperation assignments will help the clients of the EBRD, Ukrainian municipalities, to improve capacity of their utility companies, regional authorities for project implementation and follow-up, ensure compliance with stricter environmental and social standards, provide assistance with targeted reforms. This will empower Ukrainian municipalities to work on investment projects in critical municipal infrastructure with the EBRD using sophisticated financial structures and instruments. Technical cooperation funding will be used both for project development ahead of project signing and increasingly for project implementation and transition impact related activities in post-signing period. Access to dedicated funding would remove a series of obstacles in the development and implementation of underlying investment projects: insufficient capacity of municipalities and municipal utility companies to initiate, develop, implement and follow-up on investment projects, targeted sectoral reforms and other development activities. Swedish support to such critical element of the project cycle will enable EBRD to provide funding for important social, environment and climate investment projects that will act as a catalyst for sectoral reforms, provide measurable results in terms of decreased environmental pollution rates, increase sustainability of public services in areas such as district heating, water and sewage, waste management, energy efficiency and renewable energy, public transport, contribute to the climate change mitigation and adaptation efforts. The contribution will also facilitate consolidated cooperation between Sida and the EBRD to provide support to the Government of Ukraine and directly Ukrainian municipalities and regions to implement municipal and regional projects aimed at: EU-integration; Reduced emissions to the environment; Sustainable use of natural resources; Sustainable public services; Energy efficiency; Institutional reforms and sustainability of services; Transition and social inclusion; which are in compliance with EBRD’s policies, rules and procedures and the Results strategy for Sweden’s reform cooperation with Eastern Europe, the Western Balkans and Turkey.
